description: This walk takes you along the coast of the Solway Firth in the village of Powfoot in Dumfries and Galloway. The walk starts at the public car park at Powfoot Scar just west of the village. You can then head east along the beach towards Newbie and Bankirk Point. Here you will come to the mouth of the River Annan just south of Annan. On the way there are excellent views across the Solway Firth to the hills of England. At the eastern end of the walk the route links up with the Annandale Way. This long distance trail can be followed north along the River Annan into Annan town. It runs all the way to the river's source in Moffat .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north along the Annandale Way and you could visit the historic Hoddom Castle near Ecclefechan. The 16th century tower house includes some nice woodland trails, pleasant riverside trails and the Coach House restaurant.

display_address: Powfoot Golf Club, Ryehill Road, Powfoot, Dumfries and Galloway, Alba / Scotland, DG12 5QE, United Kingdom
